title: Simple App for Tasks
comment: Using this app in conjunction with my own ownCloud server. It's simple, it's stable, and works great. I'd love to see support for repeating tasks.

comment: Looks great! But without the ability to create more than one list it is very limited. it needs to have lists and folders for lists. I'll be watching for updates!

title: Rev.Dr.Timothy Lee Petrey McGregor
comment: I don't have a great memory to start with so this really helps me to plan things that I have to do & keep track of my important things while I still have them on my mind! As far as that kind of stuff goes this is a good choice to download. So thats my opinion of this app. -Thanks-& God Bless You all.

title: Great with ownCloud Tasks
comment: Really easy to use. Simple UI.

title: Works
comment: Would be nice if it supported sub (nested) task lists. I'm using zimbra at the back end.

That's actually a Zimbra Bug. Nested lists are explicitly forbidden in the CalDAV specs. They should flatten the task list structure when exporting it via CalDAV. AFAIK that's already being worked on at Zimbra.
good

title: Good but widget needs improvement
comment: Great to do app! But I would like to be able to resize the widget. I can't get it to fill the screen.

title: Widget Bug
comment: Individual tasks won't open from the widget!
We've just uploaded a new version that shows notifications for due tasks. Please check it out.

title: Love it!!!!!
comment: This app has made my life so much easier. All of my list from my ipad are on my note 3 phone!!!! You are amazing!

title: Not syncing properly
comment: After installing initially it worked fine. But didnt pick up new task list created on my ipad 😡. Work round: go back to Smoothsync & reselect the calendars and tasks to sync

I like the idea of finally having an app to access my ownCloud tasks on the cellphone. Up to now, the most feasible way to manage them on my server was Thunderbird together with Lightning/SOGo. But, of course, this only works on the PC and I'd like to have an app to access what I created. The sync works, but the app doesn't support the assigned categories, which I need for sorting and filtering. Unfortunately, it only supports filtering based on predefined criteria like progress, priority, and start and due date, which is not enough for a big pile of TODOs. I hope that this is added in the future.

This app has potential but has a long way to go.  POSITIVES: - No ads - Easy to read - Ability to search 'open' tasks - Ability to prioritize tasks - Tasks can be quickly created - App tracks a lot of metadata for a task  NEGATIVES: - Was not able to figure out how to sync tasks. Not very intuitive. - Not able to search completed tasks - Not able to manage tasks via a PC - The task completed time stamp is inaccurate - Cannot create recurring tasks - No task badges/notifications - Cannot import tasks from another task manager or spreadsheet

title: Has potential.
comment: Like the simple permissions and UI is great, very crisp. Only one local list, and not even being able to rename it, is a real bummer. If that was fixed, it would definitely be 5 stars.

title: Just one problem to fix please
comment: The app is lacking support for repetitive reminding such as a weekly or a 2 monthly dates, also you can't compleat these kind of tasks ( for the current date) and expect them to show up automatically after that like how it is done on ios. So please look into this and fix it. So that I can give my 5 starts.

We'll add that feature with the next version.

From Mac reminders when I complete repeating task it always creating next one :( please fix it

I am naturally chaotic and this app really helps me.

title: Would be great if it accepted ical vtodo emails
comment: Similar to accepting an appointment into a calendar. Would be really awesome if it associated with ical vtodo tasks allowing these to be accepted from incoming emails. Could similarly send a task request (lower priority).

One of the problems is that it's impossible to know if the attachment is an event or a to-do without opening it. So the user needs to decide which App is the right one to open the attachment (the mail app won't do that). Also there is some work going on in CalConnect to improve VTODO. We want to wait for the results of this working group.

title: Works w/ Radicale and KDE Kontact
comment:
Update: It seems tasks are laid out according to GMT, rather than local time, on the "Due" tab (Today, Tomorrow, Next Days, Someday). Due dates display correctly in editing and on the server. This makes it a bit difficult to see what you've entered for Tomorrow, as it appears as Today, etc.

There's also some inconsistency when dealing with subtasks. It seems there may be two or more standards for specifying them: one way wherein the subtask is entered as a new line in the Description field, and another using a more formal specification.
Otherwise a nice little app. Looking forward to paying a few bucks for it once the kinks are worked out.

What exactly do you mean? The app shouldn't remove itself. Or do you mean the account? Did you install the workaround app for your sync app? Please contact us at support@dmfs.org.

title: Sync's But No Search Function
comment: The app syncs fine both directions between my Mac and Samsung Note 3.  BUT the app has no search function so I cannot locate a task once entered.  I have hundreds of tasks, but cannot locate the one I want by searching on title or contents.  Very frustrating.  Thanks for your feedback.  The app stopped sync'ing now for no apparent reason.  Doesn't work.
We've plans for a search function. At present we're still working on the basics, like alarms.

title: Great tool
comment: Excellent companion to calendar sync tool.  Task list widget is great.

title: Functional and useful, but marred by awkward 'complete' gesture
comment: This is a solid app, and very useful if others in your household use iCloud, but I find that the 'swipe to complete' gesture is virtually impossible to do one-handed. Since I use Tasks for a shared grocery list, not being able to mark something off the list with one hand while shopping is a big deal. If I could find another app that would work with Reminders, I'd jump ship in a heartbeat.

Hi David, thanks for your feedback. Please tell us (at support@dmfs.org) what exactly the problem with that swipe gesture is. We're always open minded for improvements. The important thing is that you hold the task for a brief moment (till it gets highlighted). We've tested it on several devices and we found it works well.
cheers
Marten

Check out the new version. The fling gesture should be better now. You just have to hold the task for a moment then just fling it to the right. Let us know if this works better.

comment: Doesn't work with autocorrect when editing tasks.

Unfortunately we had to disable auto-correction due to a bug in Android that causes a memory leak, see http://stackoverflow.com/questions/8497965/why-does-edittext-retain-its-activitys-context-in-ice-cream-sandwich/15190491 . We'll re-enable it when we find a way around that bug.

title: Developer very responsive.
comment: Originally Tasks was not displaying the lists from Reminders after I uninstalled than reinstalled the app.   I reinstalled to try to resolve an issue where the in-app back button was not responding.  The developer got back with me right away to explain that an Android initialization glitch after reinstall caused the list display issue.   He gave me the steps to correct it manually via smooth sync settings.   The in-app back button still does not work for me, but I am up and running! Thanks!
thanks, we'll fix the back button issue asap

title: Indispensable missing link
comment: Ten years ago, PalmOS could handle (and sync to desktop!) tasks - along with the three other pillars of personal information management: contacts, events and notes - just fine. In the recent past, so could Symbian. Fast forward to the marvel of modern computing - Android - only to find that the best Google offers for tasks is a shortcut to their mobile site (and they're NOT a system-supported concept in any way), while it pretends never to have heard of notes / memos at all (clue: they're not the same thing as full-blown Google Docs). And woe betide you if you want synchronizable tasks that are not Google- (or some other "cloud" server-) based.  Enter this small app that pledges to fix that - it adds task handling to the already existing CardDav / CalDav sync adapters that let you keep your contact and calendar data on your own server, offering a way to sync without having to rely on anybody else's "cloud". For privacy-conscious people like me, this app is simply an absolute, indispensable, must-have tool. Well done!

title: Great app

title: Great.

title: Great!
comment: Been using the excellent CalDav Sync and was happy to learn about this neat "extension" as it adds further value to my work calendar.  My only suggestion for improvement is to change the name of the app. Too many apps entitled 'Tasks' out there (I now have two installed on my device).

Hi Simon, thanks for you comment. It just didn't come up with a better name yet and I didn't want to delay the initial release any more just because of the name ;-)
If you know a better name, please let me know :-)

Marten
Been waiting for this...
